definition: undress
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
clothes/CL:件[jian4]/Kangxi radical 145
to dress/to wear/to put on (clothes)
classifier for medicine: dose/Taiwan pr. [fu2]

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: Born- fu said that in order to diagnosis required for beautiful woman undress.
sentences.chinese: 生來福說爲了診斷所需，要求漂亮的女病人脫衣服。

sentences.english: She stood up and began to disrobe, folding each garment neatly.
sentences.chinese: 她站起來開始脫衣服，並把每件衣服疊整齊。

sentences.english: Do you have difficulty with putting on or taking off clothing?
sentences.chinese: 你穿衣服或脫衣服有困難嗎？

sentences.english: The girls are taking their clothes off.
I'll set up the table, and you can disrobe.
sentences.chinese: 我去擺放好桌子，你可以去脫衣服了。

sentences.english: When he started undressing in public I didn't know where to look.
sentences.chinese: 他在大庭廣衆之下脫衣服，我感到很難爲情。

sentences.english: Watching instructional videos on how to striptease can help you.
sentences.chinese: 觀看如何跳脫衣服的指導視頻可以幫助你。

sentences.english: You’re already naked, why not get down to business?
sentences.chinese: 你已經準備脫衣服了，爲什麼不幹點正事呢？

sentences.english: As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to an heavy heart.
sentences.chinese: 對傷心的人唱歌，就如冷天脫衣服，又如鹼上倒醋。

sentences.english: Um, be careful with taking clothing on and off.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，穿衣服和脫衣服時要小心。

sentences.english: Maybe Apollonia had wanted hire to help her to undress .
sentences.chinese: 也許阿波羅妮婭想要他幫着她脫衣服。

sentences.english: You take off your clothes for money?
Well, my grandfather was never going to get undressed again.
sentences.chinese: 我的祖父不會再脫衣服。

sentences.english: As soon as you enter your bedroom, it undresses you automatically.
sentences.chinese: 你一走進臥室，它就自動幫你脫衣服。

sentences.english: he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, [and as] vinegar upon nitre, so [is] he that singeth songs to an heavy heart.
sentences.chinese: 對傷心的人唱歌，就如冷天脫衣服，又如鹼上倒醋。

definition: (dialect) to take a shower
to lose money instead of being paid (i.e. sb should pay me, but is actually taking my money)
to strip naked/to strip nude/(coll.) to find oneself a partner
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
brow beaded with sweat/perspiring freely
(of a man) to dress as a woman (idiom)
to be made to stand still as a punishment
to fall down
dew point/(coll.) (of a woman) to expose one of the three areas (nipples and genitals)
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
clumsy/all thumbs
to abuse roundly
(coll.) to beat it/to take French leave
hair gel
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
to have a close call/to have a narrow escape
